bibl.title: Letter from G.H. Hazlehurst to Henry Rose Carter, October 13, 1922

div1.p: Hazlehurst thanks Carter for his comments on the proposed Alabama public health regulations.

div1.head: Letter from G.H. Hazlehurst to Henry Rose Carter, October 13, 1922
div1.opener:
ALABAMA
GREAT SEAL
S. W. WELCH, M. D.
STATE HEALTH OFFICER
FANNIE K. CENTERFIT,
SECRETARY
N. M. C.
I. Water
BUREAUS:
VITAL STATISTICS
HYGIENIC LABORATORY
ENGINEERING
COUNTY ORGANIZATION
VENEREAL DISEASE CONTROL
CHILD HYGIENE AND PUBLIC
HEALTH NURSING
EPIDEMIOLOGY
INSPECTION
PUBLICITY AND
EDUCATION
Alabama State Board of Health
STATE CAPITOL
Montgomery
Oct. 13th, 1922.
Dr. H. R. Carter,
2121 California Street, N. W.
Washington, D. C.
Dear Dr. Carter:-
div1.p:
This will acknowledge
receipt of your letter of October 3rd.

I wish to thank you
very heartily for your detailed consideration of
our proposed regulations and appreciate very much
all of the suggestions you have made. Those which
are not covered in explanation and interpretation
will be given full consideration.

The copies of the articles
which you enclosed will be returned to you within a
few days.

Thanking you again for your
kind attention to my request, I am,
div1.closer:
Very truly yours, G. H. Hazlehurst,
Chief Sanitary Engineer. GHH:E
